main event: On February 14, 1957, several civilians reported seeing three flying objects in a V formation over Marrero, Louisiana. The objects appeared to be circling the area over the Huey P. Long Bridge and Marrero at high altitudes and were observed for a duration of 1 hour and 40 minutes.
interesting points: Multiple civilians reported the sighting of three flying objects in a V formation, which then dispersed, accelerated, and disappeared upon the appearance of two aircraft in the area.
Moisant Airport radar detected nebulous targets in the area, further supporting the existence of unidentified flying objects.
The flying objects were described as having one white light and one red light. The red light appeared like a sparkler.
Observers believed that the objects were not aircraft, and the characteristics and maneuvers observed did not align with typical aircraft behavior.
The observation lasted for 1 hour and 40 minutes, providing ample time for witnesses to report detailed observations of the objects' movements and characteristics.
sighted object: three flying objects in a V formation with one white light and one red light
